intro: Solanecio kangae, commonly known as the Kangae's bluebell, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue or violet bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, where it thrives in cool, moist conditions. Its leaves are usually narrow and grass-like, adapting to the harsh mountain climate. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Solanecio kangae is considered a rare and endangered species.
